verses.verse: At the end <S%H7093><s%> of every seven <S%H7651><s%> years <S%H8141><s%> thou shalt make <S%H6213><s%> a release <S%H8059><s%>.

And this is the manner <S%H1697><s%> of the release <S%H8059><s%>: every creditor <S%H4874><s%> shall release <S%H8058><s%> that which he hath lent <S%H5383><s%> unto his neighbor <S%H7453><s%>; he shall not exact <S%H5065><s%> it of his neighbor <S%H7453><s%> and his brother <S%H251><s%>; because Jehovah <S%H3068><s%>'s release <S%H8059><s%> hath been proclaimed <S%H7121><s%>.
Of a foreigner <S%H5237><s%> thou mayest exact <S%H5065><s%> it <S%H251><s%>: but whatsoever of thine is with thy brother thy hand <S%H3027><s%> shall release <S%H8058><s%>.

Howbeit <S%H657><s%> there shall be no poor <S%H34><s%> with thee <S%H3068><s%>; (for Jehovah will surely <S%H1288><s%> bless <S%H1288><s%> thee in the land <S%H776><s%> which Jehovah <S%H3068><s%> thy God <S%H430><s%> giveth <S%H5414><s%> thee for an inheritance <S%H5159><s%> to possess it <S%H3423><s%>;)

if only thou diligently <S%H8085><s%> hearken <S%H8085><s%> unto the voice <S%H6963><s%> of Jehovah <S%H3068><s%> thy God <S%H430><s%>, to observe <S%H8104><s%> to do <S%H6213><s%> all this commandment <S%H4687><s%> which I command <S%H6680><s%> thee this day <S%H3117><s%>.

For Jehovah <S%H3068><s%> thy God <S%H430><s%> will bless <S%H1288><s%> thee <S%H1696><s%>, as he promised thee <S%H5670><s%>: and thou shalt lend unto many <S%H7227><s%> nations <S%H1471><s%>, but thou shalt not borrow <S%H5670><s%>; and thou shalt rule <S%H4910><s%> over many <S%H7227><s%> nations <S%H1471><s%>, but they shall not rule over thee <S%H4910><s%>.

If there be with thee a poor man <S%H34><s%>, one <S%H259><s%> of thy brethren <S%H251><s%>, within any <S%H259><s%> of thy gates <S%H8179><s%> in thy land <S%H776><s%> which Jehovah <S%H3068><s%> thy God <S%H430><s%> giveth <S%H5414><s%> thee <S%H553><s%>, thou shalt not harden thy heart <S%H3824><s%>, nor shut <S%H7092><s%> thy hand <S%H3027><s%> from thy poor <S%H34><s%> brother <S%H251><s%>;

but thou shalt surely <S%H6605><s%> open <S%H6605><s%> thy hand <S%H3027><s%> unto him <S%H5670><s%>, and shalt surely lend <S%H5670><s%> him sufficient <S%H1767><s%> for his need <S%H4270><s%> in that which he wanteth <S%H2637><s%>.

Beware <S%H8104><s%> that there be not a base <S%H1100><s%> thought <S%H1697><s%> in thy heart <S%H3824><s%>, saying <S%H559><s%>, The seventh <S%H7651><s%> year <S%H8141><s%>, the year <S%H8141><s%> of release <S%H8059><s%>, is at hand <S%H7126><s%>; and thine eye <S%H5869><s%> be evil <S%H7489><s%> against thy poor <S%H34><s%> brother <S%H251><s%>, and thou give <S%H5414><s%> him nought <S%H7121><s%>; and he cry unto Jehovah <S%H3068><s%> against thee <S%H2399><s%>, and it be sin unto thee.

Thou shalt surely <S%H5414><s%> give <S%H5414><s%> him <S%H3824><s%>, and thy heart shall not be grieved <S%H3415><s%> when thou givest <S%H5414><s%> unto him <S%H1558><s%>; because that for this thing <S%H1697><s%> Jehovah <S%H3068><s%> thy God <S%H430><s%> will bless <S%H1288><s%> thee in all thy work <S%H4639><s%>, and in all that thou puttest <S%H4916><s%> thy hand unto <S%H3027><s%>.

For the poor <S%H34><s%> will never cease <S%H2308><s%> out of <S%H7130><s%> the land <S%H776><s%>: therefore I command <S%H6680><s%> thee <S%H559><s%>, saying, Thou shalt surely <S%H6605><s%> open <S%H6605><s%> thy hand <S%H3027><s%> unto thy brother <S%H251><s%>, to thy needy <S%H34><s%>, and to thy poor <S%H6041><s%>, in thy land <S%H776><s%>.

If thy brother <S%H251><s%>, a Hebrew man <S%H5680><s%>, or a Hebrew woman <S%H5680><s%>, be sold <S%H4376><s%> unto thee <S%H5647><s%>, and serve thee six <S%H8337><s%> years <S%H8141><s%>; then in the seventh <S%H7637><s%> year <S%H8141><s%> thou shalt let him go <S%H7971><s%> free from thee <S%H2670><s%>.
And when thou lettest <S%H7971><s%> him go free <S%H2670><s%> from thee <S%H7971><s%>, thou shalt not let him go empty <S%H7387><s%>:

thou shalt furnish <S%H6059><s%> him liberally <S%H6059><s%> out of thy flock <S%H6629><s%>, and out of thy threshing-floor <S%H1637><s%>, and out of thy winepress <S%H3342><s%>; as Jehovah <S%H3068><s%> thy God <S%H430><s%> hath blessed <S%H1288><s%> thee thou shalt give unto him <S%H5414><s%>.

And thou shalt remember <S%H2142><s%> that thou wast a bondman <S%H5650><s%> in the land <S%H776><s%> of Egypt <S%H4714><s%>, and Jehovah <S%H3068><s%> thy God <S%H430><s%> redeemed <S%H6299><s%> thee <S%H6680><s%>: therefore I command thee this thing <S%H1697><s%> to-day <S%H3117><s%>.

And it shall be <S%H559><s%>, if he say unto thee <S%H3318><s%>, I will not go out from thee <S%H157><s%>; because he loveth thee and thy house <S%H1004><s%>, because he is well with thee <S%H2895><s%>;

then thou shalt take <S%H3947><s%> an awl <S%H4836><s%>, and thrust <S%H5414><s%> it through his ear <S%H241><s%> unto the door <S%H1817><s%>, and he shall be thy servant <S%H5650><s%> for ever <S%H5769><s%>. And also unto thy maid-servant <S%H519><s%> thou shalt do likewise <S%H6213><s%>.

It shall not seem hard <S%H7185><s%> unto thee <S%H5869><s%>, when thou lettest him go <S%H7971><s%> free <S%H2670><s%> from thee <S%H4932><s%>; for to the double of the hire <S%H7939><s%> of a hireling <S%H7916><s%> hath he served <S%H5647><s%> thee six <S%H8337><s%> years <S%H8141><s%>: and Jehovah <S%H3068><s%> thy God <S%H430><s%> will bless <S%H1288><s%> thee in all that thou doest <S%H6213><s%>.

All the firstling <S%H1060><s%> males <S%H2145><s%> that are born <S%H3205><s%> of thy herd <S%H1241><s%> and of thy flock <S%H6629><s%> thou shalt sanctify <S%H6942><s%> unto Jehovah <S%H3068><s%> thy God <S%H430><s%>: thou shalt do no work <S%H5647><s%> with the firstling <S%H1060><s%> of thy herd <S%H7794><s%>, nor shear <S%H1494><s%> the firstling <S%H1060><s%> of thy flock <S%H6629><s%>.

Thou shalt eat <S%H398><s%> it before <S%H6440><s%> Jehovah <S%H3068><s%> thy God <S%H430><s%> year <S%H8141><s%> by year <S%H8141><s%> in the place <S%H4725><s%> which Jehovah <S%H3068><s%> shall choose <S%H977><s%>, thou and thy household <S%H1004><s%>.

And if it have any blemish <S%H3971><s%>, as if it be lame <S%H6455><s%> or blind <S%H5787><s%>, any ill <S%H7451><s%> blemish <S%H3971><s%> whatsoever <S%H2076><s%>, thou shalt not sacrifice it unto Jehovah <S%H3068><s%> thy God <S%H430><s%>.

Thou shalt eat <S%H398><s%> it within thy gates <S%H8179><s%>: the unclean <S%H2931><s%> and the clean <S%H2889><s%> shall eat it alike <S%H3162><s%>, as the gazelle <S%H6643><s%>, and as the hart <S%H354><s%>.
Only thou shalt not eat <S%H398><s%> the blood <S%H1818><s%> thereof <S%H8210><s%>; thou shalt pour it out upon the ground <S%H776><s%> as water <S%H4325><s%>.
